_header: With four horse all snow white
_description: A couplet from Ovid, Ars amatoria i.114, in Trevisa’s translation of Higden’s Polychronicon (Book 1, chap. 25).

CamStJohn204.Editions:
Babington,  Churchill,  and  Joseph Rawson Lumby, eds.  
             Polychronicon Ranulphi Higden Monachi Cestrensis.
             9 vols. 
             Rolls Series
         41 (1865-66; repr. Kraus, 1964): 1.239.
Mätzner,  Edouard Adolf Ferdinand. 
             Altenglische Sprachproben, I: Poesie.
         Berlin: Wiedmann, 1867: 2.368.

BLAdd24194.Transcription:
Wiþ foure hors al snowe whiȝteþu schalt sire Emperoure
                    weende

BLCottTibDVII.Transcription:
Wiþ four hors al snow whytþow schalt sire Emperour
                    wende

BLHar1900.Transcription:
Wiþ foure horses alle snowe whiteþu schalt sire Emperour
                    wende

BLSto65.Transcription:
with four horses all snow whytethou shalt syre Emperour wende
                    yet amonge all this worshyp
BLSto65.Note:
Written as prose. Folio number reflects the most recent
                    foliation.

AbeUL21.Transcription:
Wiþ foure hors al snowe whiȝte þou schaltsire
                    Emperoure weende
